text.text_translated: A gene is a small part of your body. It tells your body how to grow and work. We have more questions about genes. We want to know how they change our brain and language. Did some genes change and help us to speak? Scientists found a change in a gene. This change happened a long time ago. It happened between 100,000 and 200,000 years ago. This gene seems important for speaking. It helps our brain move our mouth and face. Monkeys have a similar gene. But their gene did not change. We do not know now how important genes are for language. But maybe one day we will find the answers in our DNA. DNA is the information inside our body. It tells our body everything it needs to do.

feedback.feedback: The text is a perfect example of A2 writing. All sentences are simple and declarative. Vocabulary is strictly A1/A2. The key terms 'gene' and 'DNA' are introduced and immediately defined in simple, understandable language. Factual accuracy is maintained perfectly. No corrections are needed.
